H0.text: Anemometer is what meteorologists use to measure the amount of precipitation that falls during a storm.

H1.text: Barometer is the device meteorologists use to measure the amount of precipitation that falls during a storm.

H2.text: Rain gauge is the instrument meteorologists use to measure the amount of precipitation that falls during a storm.

H3.text: Weather vane is what meteorologists use to measure the amount of precipitation that falls during a storm.

A4.text: A rain gauge (also known as udometer, ombrometer, pluviometer and hyetometer) is an instrument used by meteorologists and hydrologists to gather and measure the amount of liquid precipitation in a predefined area, over a set period of time.

A5.text: A weighing-type precipitation gauge consists of a storage bin, which is weighed to record the mass.
